actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today .

H.R. 4366 (Rep. Carter):
        A bill making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes .

        -- Motion to proceed to measure considered in Senate.


 S. 2795 (Sen. Tester):
        A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to extend and modify certain authorities and requirements relating to the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

        -- Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.


 S.Res. 341 (Sen. Klobuchar):
        A resolution recognizing September 19, 2023, as "National Voter Registration Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mrs. Murray, at  5:57 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
